sentences: Lennuk tegi linna kohal mitu tiiru.
context: "Kohal" in Estonian has two main uses: as a postposition meaning 'above', 'over', or 'nearby' when indicating spatial relationship (something being at a higher level than something else), and as an adverb meaning 'present', 'at the location', or 'here' when referring to someone being in the expected place. It can also indicate arrival at a destination.
